009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
012import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
013
014import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
015
016import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
017import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D65;
018
019/**
020 * <p>
021 * Implementation of a D65-based XYZ color space, as a substitute for Java's built-in standard connection space
022 * (obtained with {@code  ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_CIEXYZ)}), with improved accuracy. The reference white
023 * point of this color space is D50 and any XYZ coordinate passed to {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])} is assumed to be
024 * relative to D50 as well, thus no conversion (color adaptation) is necessary between XYZ values. See Sec. 14.1.1 of
025 * [1] for details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/11/14
034 * @see XYZ50ColorSpace
035 */
036@SuppressWarnings("serial")
037public class XYZ65ColorSpace extends ColorSpace implements DirectD65Conversion {
038        private static final sRGB65ColorSpace srgbCS = sRGB65ColorSpace.getInstance();
039        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
040        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
041        private static final XYZ65ColorSpace instance = new XYZ65ColorSpace();
042
043        public static XYZ65ColorSpace getInstance() {
044                return instance;
045        }
046
047        private XYZ65ColorSpace() {
048                super(TYPE_XYZ, 3);
049        }
050
051        // ----------------------------------------------------
052
053        @Override       // convert this D65-based XYZ to sRGB
054        public float[] toRGB(float[] thisXYZ65) {
055                float[] XYZ50 = this.toCIEXYZ(thisXYZ65);       // could be done directly!!
056                float[] srgb = srgbCS.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
057                return srgb;
058        }
059
060        @Override
061        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
062                float[] XYZ50 = srgbCS.toCIEXYZ(srgb);
063                return this.fromCIEXYZ(XYZ50);
064        }
065        
066        // -------------------------------------------------
067        
068        @Override       // convert this CS D65 XYZ to standard D50 XYZ
069        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] thisXYZ65) {
070                return catD65toD50.applyTo(thisXYZ65);
071        }
072        
073        @Override       // convert standard D50 XYZ to this CS D65 XYZ
074        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {
075                return catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);
076        }
077        
078        // -------------------------------------------------
079
080        @Override
081        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {
082                return XYZ65;
083        }
084
085        @Override
086        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {
087                return XYZ65;
088        }
089
090}
